intro: Calochortus maweanus var. major, commonly known as the Mawea mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposas or "dwarf marigolds." This particular variety is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has fibrous roots and is adapted to thrive in arid environments with minimal water availability.
